title: Week 2: January 5–11 - Moses 1; Abraham 3
content:
# I Am a Child of God!

## Lesson Overview
We will teach little ones that they are children of God who Heavenly Father loves (Moses 1:4). This helps them feel special and know God has work for them (Moses 1:6, 39).

## TEACHER LESSON (8-10 minutes)
**Get Attention (1-2 minutes):** Hold up a big smiley face picture. Say, "Smile big—who loves you most? Heavenly Father does!" Have kids copy your big smile and wiggle their happy dance.

**Simple Story (3-4 minutes):** Show pictures of Moses. "Moses saw Heavenly Father and Jesus. Heavenly Father said, 'Moses, you are my son!' (Moses 1:4). Then a bad guy, Satan, came and said, 'Worship me!' (Moses 1:12). Moses said no! He prayed and said, 'Get behind me, Satan!' (Moses 1:20). Heavenly Father helped him. We lived with Heavenly Father as spirits before earth (Abraham 3:22). Now we are His children here!"

**Big Idea (2-3 minutes):** Point to each child: "You are a child of God! (Moses 1:4). Say it with me: 'I am a child of God!' Again! Heavenly Father loves you and has work for you (Moses 1:39)."

**We Can Do This (1-2 minutes):** "Like Moses, say no to bad things. Pray and Heavenly Father helps! Hug a friend and say, 'You are a child of God!'"

## Wiggle Activity (2-3 minutes)
**Spirit March:** March around the room like happy spirits coming from heaven to earth (Abraham 3:22). Sing "Twinkle Twinkle Little Star" tune: "I am a child of God" while flapping arms like flying spirits. Stop and freeze when you say "Freeze!"

## Simple Scripture
"I am a child of God" (Moses 1:4).  
Say it 3 times together. Point to your heart, then hug yourself. Clap on "child"!

## Fun Activities (15 minutes total)
**1. Mirror Me! (Object Lesson, 3 minutes)**  
*What to do:* 1. Give each child a small mirror. 2. Look in mirror and smile. 3. Say together, "I am a child of God!" (Moses 1:4).  
*Materials:* Small mirrors (one per child).  
*What to say:* "Look! Heavenly Father made you special (Moses 1:4). Smile and say it loud!"

**2. No to Satan Game (Physical Activity, 4 minutes)**  
*What to do:* 1. Kids stand. 2. Say good choice (share toy)—jump yes! Bad choice (push friend)—shake head no and step back. 3. Like Moses (Moses 1:20).  
*Materials:* None.  
*What to say:* "Moses said no to Satan (Moses 1:12–26). Jump for good choices!"

**3. God’s Kid Crafts (Hands-On Crafts, 4 minutes)**  
*What to do:* 1. Draw your face on paper plate. 2. Add happy eyes and "I am a child of God!" sticker. 3. Hold up high.  
*Materials:* Paper plates, crayons, stickers.  
*What to say:* "Draw you as Heavenly Father’s child (Moses 1:4). He loves your picture!"

**4. Follow the Plan Dance (Music & Movement, 4 minutes)**  
*What to do:* 1. Sing "I Will Follow God’s Plan" with claps. 2. March for "before I came," jump for "plan of love." 3. Freeze and say "I am a child of God!"  
*Materials:* None.  
*What to say:* "We were spirits with God’s plan (Abraham 3:22). Dance it!"

## Picture Time
Show "Moses Sees Jehovah" by Joseph Brickey (detail, from bundle). Ask: "Who is Moses talking to? How does Moses look happy? You can feel God’s love too!"

## Song
"I Am a Child of God" (Children’s Songbook, 2–3). Add actions: Point up for "Heavenly Father," hug self for "child of God," march for "here on earth."

## Snack Idea
Heart-shaped crackers. "Hearts like God’s love for His children (Moses 1:4)!"

## Testimony Moment
"Heavenly Father and Jesus love you so much—you are Their child (Moses 1:4)." Invite: "Say 'I love Heavenly Father!' " Give hugs.

## Teacher Survival Tips
1. Use a timer for each activity—wiggly kids love "next fun!"  
2. If a child disrupts, hug and whisper "You are a child of God—help a friend!"  
3. No mirrors? Use shiny spoons. Shorten if needed—more wiggles!
